definition: see 遠水救不了近火|远水救不了近火[yuan3 shui3 jiu4 bu5 liao3 jin4 huo3]
pinyin: yuan3 shui3 bu4 jiu4 jin4 huo3

definition: to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
(negative prefix)/not/no
to save/to assist/to rescue
variant of 救[jiu4]
near/close to/approximately
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: I know you want to help, but it is almost too late to do anything.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你很想帮忙，但是远水不救近火。

definition: water in a distant place is of little use in putting out a fire right here/(fig.) a slow remedy does not address the current emergency
pinyin: yuan3 shui3 jiu4 bu5 liao3 jin4 huo3

definition: lit. distant water does not cure present thirst; fig. urgent need/a slow remedy does not address immediate needs
pinyin: yuan3 shui3 bu4 jie3 jin4 ke3

definition: see 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3]
Wu and Yue in the same boat (idiom); fig. cooperation between natural rivals/to collaborate towards a common end/in the same boat together
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
lit. to bend the chimney and remove the firewood (to prevent fire) (idiom)/fig. to take preventive measures
as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
lit. to carry firewood to put out a fire (idiom); fig. to make a problem worse by inappropriate action
to burn one's eyebrows/fig. desperately serious situation

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

definition: lit. the crisis of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation/dire straits
to beat a tiger from the front door, only to have a wolf come in at the back (idiom); fig. facing one problem after another
pinyin: qian2 men2 ju4 hu3 , hou4 men2 jin4 lang2

definition: lit. a single post cannot prop up a falling house (idiom)/fig. one is helpless alone
It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
internal disunity dissolves at the threat of an invasion from outside (idiom)
pinyin: xiong1 di4 xi4 yu2 qiang2 , wai4 yu4 qi2 wu3
